parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set damage on a part of an object.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Some part names are in Czech; see [[Translations|translation table]]. </value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[setHit]] [part, damage, useEffects]

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> [part, damage, useEffects]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - [[local]] object

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> part: [[String]] - Name of the part ([[Named_Selection|selection]] name)

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> damage: [[Number]] - Damage value ranging 0..1, 0 being fully functional, 1 being destroyed

</value></part><part><name>p5 </name>=<value> <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67</value></part></template> useEffects: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to skip destruction effects

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[vehicle]] [[player]] [[setHit]] ["motor", 1];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[vehicle]] [[player]] [[setHit]] ["mala vrtule", 0.95];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[local]] _heli) [[then]] {
	_heli [[setHit]] ["velka vrtule", 0];
} [[else]] {
	[[hint]] ("Vehicle " + [[str]] _heli + " must be local to this machine to do that!");
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getHit]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]], [[damage]], [[setDamage]], [[setFuel]], [[setAmmo]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Deadfast|Deadfast]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Damaging specific parts of the vehicle will not update its overall [[damage]] value (as of v1.03):
<code>[[player]] [[setHit]] ["hands", 0.9];
[[hint]] [[str]] ([[damage]] [[player]]); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>will return 0</value></part></template></code>

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:DenV|denisko.redisko]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Direct use of the names of sections of the model is likely a bad practice, and will not work on some addons.
So instead:
<code>_MH60S [[setHit]] ["elektronika", _hit];</code>
should be used:
<code>_MH60S [[setHit]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[getText]] ([[configFile]] >> "cfgVehicles" >> "MH60S" >> "HitPoints" >> "HitAvionics" >> "name"), _hit];</code>
</dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 11, 2018 - 19:37 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:HazJ|HazJ]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
You can use [[getHit]] if you are using 1.64 EOL version.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
